clinical_study.brief_title: Rapid Ventricular Pacing in Surgical Treatment of Intracranial Aneurysms
clinical_study.official_title: Rapid Ventricular Pacing in Surgical Treatment of Intracranial Aneurysms

brief_summary.textblock: Treatment of complex unruptured intracranial aneurysms (UIA) remains challenging to date. Therefore, advanced techniques are required to achieve an optimal result in treating these patients safely. In this study, the safety and efficacy of rapid ventricular pacing (RVP) to facilitate microsurgical clip-reconstruction has been studied prospectively in a joined neurosurgical, anesthesiological and cardiological study.

detailed_description.textblock: Treatment of complex unruptured intracranial aneurysms (UIA) remains challenging to date. Therefore, advanced techniques are required to achieve an optimal result in treating these patients safely. In this study, the safety and efficacy of rapid ventricular pacing (RVP) to facilitate microsurgical clip-reconstruction has been studied prospectively in a joined neurosurgical, anesthesiological and cardiological study. Patients with complex UIA were prospectively enrolled and the safety and efficacy of RVP were evaluated recording cardiovascular events and outcome of the patients as well as the amount of aneurysm occlusion after the surgical clip-reconstruction procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of flow reduction and improvement of clip application
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy of flow reduction (failure rate of pacing; measuring of heart rate and blood pressure). Also improvement of clip application: performing surgeon has to complete a questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: intraoperatively upt o 24 hours after operation
secondary_outcome.description: Complications during insertion, positioning, application (intraoperatively) and removal of pacing catheter (postoperatively on ICU). Anesthesiologist has to complete a questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: intraoperatively upt o 24 hours after operation
secondary_outcome.description: All cardiovascular events will be documented (like arrhythmias etc.). Also preoperative heart values (of Troponin T, CK, CK-MB) and values after operation and one day after operation will be documented and afterwards analyzed. Reference values (05/2016): CK <190 U/l; CK-MB <24 U/l; Troponin T <14pg/ml Number of Participants With Abnormal Laboratory Values and/or Adverse Events That Are Related to Treatment were documented and analyzed.
Angiography to control the occlusion of the aneurysm, regularly 1 week after surgical clipping.

intervention.description: Use of Rapid Ventricular Pacing to improve surgical clipping of intracranial aneurysms

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- complex UIA intended to be treated by microsurgical clip-reconstruction
- application of RVP intra-operatively
Exclusion Criteria:
- structural heart disease or conductance abnormalities
